radiographic_examinations.findings: Rounded hypoechoic lesion in the periphery of the right hepatic lobe measuring approximately 1.4 cm may represent a hemangioma. Multiple large shadowing stones within the gallbladder, which is mildly distended. Mild wall thickening and wall edema of the gallbladder. No biliary dilatation or textural abnormality of the liver. No pericholecystic fluid.
